website_summaries.verdict: Not only is this savory turkey-based broth a nutrition-packed snack for picky eaters, since the serving size is 2 teaspoons per 20 pounds, this box will last through many meals.
pros: Filtered water and turkey are the first 2 ingredients
Works as an excellent treat or food topper
cons: Not for cats trying to avoid common poultry allergies

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in how little you get for your money
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I thought 17 oz was a lot more. This is a tiny little 4 inch tall container of bone broth for $13... I feel so stupid because Petsmart carries this for $5.00!
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive
customer_reviews.text: I did not know that I could simply purchase this from any of a number of retailers for LESS than HALF of what I paid for this one. The product itself is GREAT. The price was way too much. I did not give this a 1-star rating because the product is good. There is no way to differentiate between the actual product and the supplier. Compromised.
customer_reviews.author: jorgeviola

customer_reviews.title: Seems high quality, but kitty doesn’t like it
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves normal human broth, but I know it’s not good for her, so in an effort to get her to take more liquids, I bought this instead. It’s a very small box, and she won’t touch it! My vet recommended that swanson’s broth is safe for kitties, too. You c an get double the broth for about a quarter of the price. This was a waste of my money, but appears to be high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Cranston

customer_reviews.title: Tye Liked It
customer_reviews.text: Last thing our 15 year old boy was willing to drink. It smelled really good. Tad expensive though. If I have to buy it again I will freeze it in ice cube trays and warm a cube at a time.
customer_reviews.author: G. Chow

customer_reviews.title: Multi cats disliked
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't recommend this item. I have multiple cats in home and the one I bought for specifically won't touch it. The others sniff it and walk away. It's odd when my cats love chicken. I tried with food and without. Wouldn't recommend sadly for cost reasons unless you know for sure your cat(s) like it.
customer_reviews.author: Lors

customer_reviews.title: My cat wouldn't touch it
customer_reviews.text: I gave her a little of this, and she wouldn't even give it a try! I think I will just try boiling some chicken bones - much cheaper and without vegetable components that may be the part that is distasteful to my cat.
customer_reviews.author: Patches' Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old Amstaff loves it. We put it on her dry food to make it more palatable. Also, it is an established fact that bone broth is good for dogs. Especially if they have joint issues. Now, often my wife makes a broth herself, but this container with broth is so handy to have in the fridge. Finally, aroma is so good, it suggest real deal.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Zynn

customer_reviews.title: Delish Bone Broth for Cats!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 cats always loved the "gravy" that came with cat "appetizers." So, I tried one box of the bone broth. They lap it up! They absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.author: rose marie

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Dogs loved it but it ran out within a few days. Don’t get much for what you pay. Won’t buy again but it was good while it lasted!
customer_reviews.author: Noel Michael

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the pruce
customer_reviews.text: Cat wouldn’t eat the broth. Dog did but he’ll eat most anything.
customer_reviews.author: Kloeylee

customer_reviews.title: Both my senior cat and my husky love this. I freeze it in silicone ice cube ...
customer_reviews.text: Both my senior cat and my husky love this. I freeze it in silicone ice cube trays for hot days or pour some over their dry food to mix things up.
customer_reviews.author: A. Mayorga

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: pricey for the size you get but adds nicely to homemade dog food
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: My picky cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this broth and they are super picky! A great way to incorporate a healthy diet for them. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: LisaM

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: Is great my dog loves it, the only thing is I found it on pet smart 50% less than here, just do your research, other than that good.
customer_reviews.author: mario

customer_reviews.title: Broth
customer_reviews.text: If you have a picky cat, and only wants to eat gravy your cat will love this broth;
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Dietary aide for small dog
customer_reviews.text: Helped our little dog adjust to her new diet when we brought her home.
customer_reviews.author: A Carlson

customer_reviews.title: She likes it.
customer_reviews.text: Feeding it to our cat that has nasal cancer. She likes it. It's a bit on the expesive side, but worth it considering that it may make her feel better. She has lasted 5 months longer than expected, and still going.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must buy after surgery!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 5 year old Chiweenie to add to her water after a hernia revision surgery to entice her to drink fluids. Worked amazingly. Definitely will be adding it to her food as well to get her to eat. Wish I had purchased it for the first surgery!
customer_reviews.author: Anja

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: My bone broth leaked out of both containers I just threw them out
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dogs loved it
customer_reviews.text: All six of my dogs would drink this out of a bowl with nothing added. I was shocked. Judging by the ingredients it is extremely healthy. Way over-priced, you can buy it from other retailers much cheaper. I home cook so I also make my own. Put a whole chicken in your pressure cooker for an hour and you have lots of natural bone broth. Remove the bones from the chicken (never give cooked bones to your dogs as they can splinter) and the dogs will LOVE the chicken too. I also keep this broth on hand because it is convenient and they love it.
customer_reviews.author: Anne MarieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: So far so good great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product from a big box store I read good things about only natural pet food company Ihave read they make fantastic freeze dried food so we decided to try the bone broth and my dog loves it last for us about 8 to 9 days 4 tablespoons a day when I called that they said it stays good for 7 to 10 days but after that you should throw it out just started feeding her this even though it does not last long it definitely whorth it I have read its very healthy for your Dog🐶
customer_reviews.author: 91TA

customer_reviews.title: Inspires Munchkin to drink more water
customer_reviews.text: Dog loves this added to her water. Purchased at PETSMART for 4.99. Product does as promised, but selling price on Amazon is almost triple.
customer_reviews.author: M. Castronova

customer_reviews.title: Careful.  Tastes like poison.  Pet parents, try a drop and see.
customer_reviews.text: I would be very very careful. I tasted this product myself (a few drops) and it tastes like poison. Absolutely horrible I cannot imagine that it would be good for the pet but the kitties who are not wanting to partake of this are using their senses to realize it's not something they want.
customer_reviews.author: KMK

customer_reviews.title: I don't think so says kitty.
customer_reviews.text: They ruined it with odd ball ingredients no self respecting cat would touch.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: BUY from the Manufacturer!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. However, after being out of stock at my local pet store, I discovered that I could purchase it at a lower cost from the manufacturer...so check out their website!!!
customer_reviews.author: Christopherobin

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: I add a little to my dog's food and she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: M

product_meta.title: Only Natural Pet Human Grade Bone Broth Nutrition Boost
product_meta.description: Flavor Name:Turkey Broth| Size:17 oz100% Human Grade Bone Broth made from cage free chicken & turkey and grass fed beef. Delicious liquid dog treat & cat treat that's packed with nutrients!
feature_bullets: DELICIOUS, HEALTHY NUTRITION BOOST - This ready to serve turkey broth can work as a nutrition boost, a savory food topper, a tasty treat, or an enticement for finicky dogs & cats.
100% HUMAN GRADE, FREE RANGE TURKEY BONES - Made with the highest quality, free range turkey bones & healthy fruits, vegetables & superfood chia seeds & turmeric, this formula is 100% human grade.

NATURAL SOURCE OF SUPERFOOD INGREDIENTS - This human grade broth naturally features healthy superfoods & compounds, like chondroitin & collagen for healthy joints, turmeric for anti-inflammatory, & healthy fruits & veggies.

GENTLE ON THE STOMACH & IDEAL FOR JOINT HEALTH - Savory bone broth is gentle on the stomach, making for a nutritious treat for pets with upset stomachs and it's filled with joint supporting compounds, like collagen & chondroitin.

SATISFACTION GUARANTEE - Only Natural Pet products always include a 100% Satisfaction Guarantee. Only Natural Pet uses only the highest quality ingredients in our recipes. Providing you & your pet the highest quality products is our top priority.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
